title: type ID
content:
Can anyone tell me what font is being used for the text that say WEISZ on this magazine cover?

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Zembla\_Cover\_002\_850.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130620201839/http:/typophile.com/files/Zembla_Cover_002_850.jpg) | 116.49 KB |
author: nhood

comments.content: hm. [Arete Mono](http://web.archive.org/web/20130620201839/http:/www.fonts.com/font/t-26/arete-mono/regular) matches most. seems as if the M & W glyphs are the oddballs, but only for the Zembla and Weisz. alternates in there somewhere? or just special mods?

Another work by [Matt Willey](http://web.archive.org/web/20130620201839/http:/www.mattwilley.co.uk/Zembla-Magazine). Jodie is right, Arete Mono is definitely the closest you could get. As Matt Willey is well-known for his work in editorial type design (Port Magazine, Wired, Elephant Magazine, New York Times Magazine...), it could easily be a custom job based on Arete Mono, adjusting and redrawing some letters.
